trans-unit.source: Vela the Night-Clad
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·118 | Vela the Night-Clad | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.) Other creatures you control have intimidate. Whenever Vela the Night-Clad or another creature you control leaves the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·118 | Vela the Night-Clad | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Vela snuffs out every trace of Krond's reign, leaving pure nightfall in her wake.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·119 | Zedruu the Greathearted | Card Text
trans-unit.source: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of permanents you own that your opponents control. {U}{R}{W}: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step. {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}. {3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·121 | Blade of Selves | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Equipped creature has myriad. (Whenever it attacks, for each opponent other than defending player, you may create a token that's a copy of that creature that's tapped and attacking that player or a planeswalker they control. Exile the tokens at end of combat.) Equip {4}

Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature. As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Equip {0}
After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
"Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."
Flying When Sandstone Oracle enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. If that player has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.

{1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, create a 0/0 black Phyrexian Germ creature token, then attach this to it.) Equipped creature gets +1/+1. Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half their life, rounded up. Equip {3}

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·128 | Seal of the Guildpact | Card Text
trans-unit.source: As Seal of the Guildpact enters the battlefield, choose two colors. Each spell you cast costs {1} less to cast for each of the chosen colors it is.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·128 | Seal of the Guildpact | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "I'd rather see the guilds contend together with words in the halls of power, than in the streets with swords."\n—Jace Beleren
{T}: Add {C}{C}.
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.) Equip {1}
You have no maximum hand size. {T}: Add {C}.
Infinite possibilities contained in a finite space.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.
Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {C}{C}.
Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space —vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.
Arcane Sanctum enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B}.
"We must rely on our own knowledge, not on the dogma of the seekers or the mutterings of the sphinxes."\n—Tullus of Palandius
Bojuka Bog enters the battlefield tapped. When Bojuka Bog enters the battlefield, exile target player's graveyard. {T}: Add {B}.
{T}: Add {C}. {T}, Sacrifice Command Beacon: Put your commander into your hand from the command zone.
"I gazed once into that light. Now it burns in my mind, forever denying me rest."\n—Riku of Two Reflections
{T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
Crumbling Necropolis enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R}.
"They say the ruins of Sedraxis were once a shining capital in Vithia. Now it is a blight, a place to be avoided by the living."\n—Olcot, Rider of Joffik
{T}: Add {C}. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Dreadship Reef. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Dreadship Reef: Add X mana in any combination of {U} and/or {B}.
{T}: Add {C}. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Fungal Reaches. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Fungal Reaches: Add X mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}.
{T}: Add {C}. {T}: Each player gains control of all creatures they own.
"Let your heels point you home."\n—Ancient blessing
Jungle Shrine enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {R}, {G}, or {W}.
On Naya, ambition and treachery are scarce, hunted nearly to extinction by the awe owed to terrestrial gods.
Khalni Garden enters the battlefield tapped. When Khalni Garden enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 green Plant creature token. {T}: Add {G}.

Krosan Verge enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {C}. {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Krosan Verge: Search your library for a Forest card and a Plains card, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
{T}: Add {C}. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Molten Slagheap. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Molten Slagheap: Add X mana in any combination of {B} and/or {R}.
{T}: Add {C}. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Saltcrusted Steppe. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Saltcrusted Steppe: Add X mana in any combination of {G} and/or {W}.
Savage Lands enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {B}, {R}, or {G}.
Jund is a world as cruel as those who call it home. Their brutal struggles scar the land even as it carves them in its image, a vicious circle spiraling out of control.
Seaside Citadel enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {G}, {W}, or {U}.
For wisdom's sake, it was built high to gaze on all things. For glory's sake, it was built high as a testament of power. For strength's sake, it was built high to repel all attacks.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·149 | Temple of the False God | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {T}: Add {C}{C}. Activate only if you control five or more lands.

trans-unit.resname: PZ1·149 | Temple of the False God | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Those who bring nothing to the temple take nothing away.
